Obwohl eine dialysepflichtige Niereninsuffizienz bei Erwachsenen ein häufiger Grund für chronischen Pruritus ist (Prävalenz 20 %), leiden nur ca. 9 % der dialysepflichtigen Kinder an diesem Symptom. ZNS-Tumoren sind ein seltener Grund für einen lokalisierten neuropathischen Pruritus. Seltener sind Medikamentennebenwirkungen anzulasten. Für Kinder sind anerkannte systemische antipruritische Therapien aufgrund der eingeschränkten Studienlage nicht verfügbar, wobei Naltrexon, Gabapentin und Cyclosporin A bei chronischem Pruritus im Kindesalter in kleinen Fallserien als wirksam nachgewiesen wurden.
1. 黒腐病の発病量は,年次による変動は少なく薬剤散布区で4%,無散布区で0.8%程度であった。2. 発病時期は,薬剤散布を行なった場合は1月から,無散布の場合は2月からど思われる。3. 発病部位は,無散布の場合は有傷部が,薬剤散布区では果頂部,果梗部からが多い。しかし,果頂部,果梗部からの発病は年によりまた月によりふれがあり,一定の傾向は認められない。

papers.title: THE ASTHMATIC CHILD AND HIS PARTICIPATION IN SPORTS AND PHYSICAL EDUCATION COMMITTEE ON CHILDREN WITH HANDICAPS
papers.abstract: Bronchial Asthma is a chronic pulmonary disorder, frequently allergic in nature, and characterized by paroxysms of dyspnea, wheezing, tightness in the chest, and bronchospasm. Asthmatic attacks may be minor and short in duration with little discomfort, or they may be very severe and of long duration, producing the characteristic picture of intractability. During symptomatic periods, it is usually possible to demonstrate changes in certain aspects of pulmonary function. With mild symptoms or between the episodes of severe asthma, the individual may be at little or no disadvantage in any or all activities. However, when the symptoms of pulmonary distress become severe or prolonged, this may lead to interruption of the child9s daily routine, including school attendance. Occasionally, such children may become home or hospital bound for long periods of time. Between the two extremes of no symptoms and severe asthma, there is a spectrum of respiratory or pulmonary disability—the nature and severity of which requires that each child receive individual consideration and evaluation in the matter of his daily activity. The outlook for the control of asthma in children has been improving during the past several decades. However, with the increase in population, there is an increasing number of children who require medical management for this disorder. It is a leading medical cause for school absenteeism and probably contributes to inefficient school work because of chronic fatigue, irritability, decreased attention span, and secondary emotional disorders. There is general agreement among physicians that most children with bronchial asthma should attend regular school since, when under proper control and with no residual pulmonary defect, the child needs no special facilities.

papers.title: Sinusitis and rhinitis, or rhinosinusitis?
papers.abstract: excision or mastectomy for breast cancer is prob- ably at least 20%,2 and mild discomfort may be experienced even more commonly.The pain is usually a late onset phenomenon, developing any- thing from a few months to several years after treatment.This problem is frequently encountered in both hospital and general practice, and failure to recog- nise the syndrome can lead to much anxiety for the patient and often fruitless and unnecessary investigations.

papers.title: Pathologies infectieuses
papers.abstract: Une infection nosocomiale (IN) est une infection survenant plus de 48 heures après l’admission. Cette définition doit néanmoins être appliquée avec réflexion, car certaines infections communautaires ont une incubation supérieure à 48 heures (comme la légionellose...) et certaines infections associées aux soins (IAS) peuvent se manifester plus rapidement (par exemple une bactériémie après geste invasif ). En contexte chirurgical une infection du site opératoire (ISO) survenant dans les 30 jours suivant le geste chirurgical est considérée comme nosocomiale. Ce délai est porté à 1 an si du matériel étranger a été mis en place.

papers.title: Prolonged and chronic cough
papers.abstract: Chronic cough is defined as a cough lasting longer than 8 weeks and in more than 95% of cases, diagnosis and treatment is successful. However, in clinical practice, some consider a cough lasting for more than 8 weeks to be too long (not actually true). Therefore, this chapter deals with the diagnosis and treatment of prolonged cough lasting 3 weeks or longer. It is important to remember that disorders causing chronic cough are also included (Fig. 4.1). Prolonged and chronic coughs are broadly divided into productive coughs (Table 2.1) and non-productive coughs (Table 2.2). For non-productive coughs, the presence or absence of an increase in cough reflex sensitivity is also listed. If a post-infectious cough or cough due to infection such as pertussis, C. pneumoniae, or Mycoplasma, does not improve with antimicrobial therapy and lasts more than 8 weeks, the infection is the likely trigger of the chronic cough. In these cases, indiscriminate use of antibiotics should not be continued. In general clinics without specialist facilities, pathophysiological diagnosis of disorders based on specialized studies is usually not possible. In these cases, evaluation should focus on identifying common disorders and providing specific and effective treatment, using available laboratory tests to aid in the diagnosis (Fig. 2.1). As shown in Figure 2.1, post-infectious cough is not considered in chronic cough. Pathophysiological diagnosis of common disorder associated with prolonged and chronic cough. GERD, gastro-esophageal reflux disease. In patients with prolonged non-productive coughs, important disorders in the differential diagnosis include cough-variant asthma, atopic cough, GERD and post-infectious cough. Among these disorders, cough reflex sensitivity is normal only in cough-variant asthma. Cough reflex sensitivity testing can be more readily performed than spirometry. A normal cough reflex sensitivity test is strongly suggestive of cough-variant asthma. In primary-care settings, specialized studies other than routine testing usually cannot be performed. Therapeutic diagnosis to identify common disorders and provide specific and effective treatment is appropriate (Fig. 2.2). However, because many coughs are self-limited or due to the placebo effect, this may not necessarily confirm a diagnosis. Therapeutic diagnosis of common disorder associated with prolonged and chronic cough. Table 2.3 lists common causes of prolonged and chronic cough in Japan that are discussed below. Note: Cough-predominant asthma. In 1979, Corrao et al.1 reported on a variant form of asthma with cough as the sole presenting symptom. Clinical features included a chronic cough without wheezing or dyspnoea, near normal pulmonary function but increased airway responsiveness, and relief of the cough with bronchodilators. This subtype of asthma, later named ‘cough-variant asthma’, is a common cause of chronic cough in Western countries2, 3 and Japan.4, 5 Coughing is usually worse at bedtime, late at night, and in the early morning. Exacerbating factors include upper respiratory infection, cold air, exercise, cigarette smoke and rainy weather. There is usually no or little sputum production. There are no symptoms or signs of wheezing, even on forced expiration (the presence of even mild wheezing excludes the diagnosis of cough-variant asthma). In adults, cough-variant asthma is more frequent in women,6-9 and in about 30% of adults, wheezing will develop with a transition to classic asthma.1, 2, 7 A type I allergic response to extrinsic antigens may play a role in at least some patients, but total IgE levels and the prevalence of specific IgE antibodies to common inhalant allergens is less than in classic asthma.9 However, worsening of symptoms during certain seasons is more common in cough-variant asthma than in classic asthma.9 Exacerbations during the autumn suggest an association with sensitization to house dust mite antigens.9 Pulmonary function testing often shows a normal FEV1 and PEF, but in the group as a whole, patients with cough-variant asthma have lower values than healthy persons8 or those with post-infectious cough. Slight diurnal variations in PEF and decreases in PEF with worsening cough are observed. Indices of peripheral airway obstruction such as MMF and V25 are often decreased.8 Improvement of cough with bronchodilators demonstrates that bronchoconstriction based on airway hyper responsiveness, albeit slight, are the cause of coughing. As compared with classic asthma, the degree of airway hyper responsiveness in cough-variant asthma is similar or less.1, 6, 8 In a study to distinguish airway sensitivity and airway reactivity, airway reactivity was less in children with cough-variant asthma than in those with asthma, but airway sensitivity was similar.10 Cough receptor sensitivity is increased in most disorders associated with chronic dry cough and probably plays a role in their pathogenesis. In cough-variant asthma and classic asthma, however, no definite conclusions have been reached about cough sensitivity. In classic asthma, an increase during acute exacerbations and antigen exposure11 and decrease with inhaled steroid treatment have been reported.12 On the other hand, an absence of changes even with antigen challenge testing13 and an increase in untreated asthmatic patients compared with healthy persons, with no change despite improved cough after treatment14 have also been described. In cough-variant asthma, no increase in cough sensitivity compared with healthy persons and absence of changes with treatment6 has been reported. However, there are also conflicting reports describing a decrease of cough sensitivity in parallel with improvement of cough after treatment.15-17 Inflammation in airways where cough receptors are located increases the cough reflex. In cough-variant asthma, eosinophils are increased in sputum, BAL fluid and bronchial mucosal tissue, and the magnitude of increase correlates with severity of disease.8 In biopsy specimens of central airway mucosa and BAL fluid from peripheral airways and lung parenchyma, the degree of eosinophilia is similar between classic asthma and cough-variant asthma, indicating no difference in the site of inflammation.8 Airway remodelling changes are also present.18, 19 This may be of pathophysiological significance, but may also be a consequence of long-term mechanical stimulation due to coughing.19 In addition, increased inflammatory mediators (e.g. histamine, prostaglandins D2 and E2 and leukotrienes C4, D4 and E4),20 increased expression of substance P,21 and decreased pH of airway lining fluid may play a role.3 Table 2.4 shows patient selection criteria for a clinical study, and Table 2.5 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. Airway hyper responsiveness tests are only available in a limited number of facilities, and their sensitivity and specificity is not 100%.22 As bronchodilators (β2 agonists and theophyllines) are not effective in chronic cough except for cough-variant asthma, improvement of cough with this treatment is diagnostic of cough-variant asthma.22 Sputum eosinophilia suggests a diagnosis of cough-variant asthma but is also present in atopic cough and eosinophilic bronchitis, which should be considered in the differential diagnosis.23 (Please see other sections.) Some patients with cough-variant asthma eventually develop wheezing with a progression to classic asthma. Statistics from a previous period when inhaled steroids were not prevalently used suggested that the rate of progression was 30–40% in adults.1 Factors that predict the development of classic asthma include airway hypersensitivity7 or maximal airway response24 to methacholine, sputum eosinophilia25 and a failure in use of inhaled steroids.7, 26 Treatment of cough-variant asthma is essentially the same as in classic asthma. 3.1.6.1 Patients with intermittent cough. Bronchodilators (short-acting inhaled β2 agonists (e.g. Sultanol®, Meptin®) or theophyllines (e.g. Theodur®, Uniphyl®, Unicon®, Theolong®, Slo-bid®)) are used as needed. 3.1.6.2 Patients with persistent cough or an intermittent cough not controlled by the above therapy. The same degrees of eosinophilic inflammation and remodeling18 as in asthma8 are present, so an inhaled steroid (e.g. fluticasone propionate (Flutide®) 200–400 µg/day, budesonide (Pulmicort®) 400–800 µg/day, HFA-BDP (Qvar®) 200–400 µg/day, or higher doses) are to be prescribed soon after diagnosis. Early treatment may prevent the progression to asthma,7, 19 and inhaled steroids are the treatment of first choice in cough-variant asthma. If needed, a long-acting β2 agonist (e.g. Serevent®, Hoknalin®) or slow-release theophylline can be added. Double-blind, placebo-controlled studies have also reported effectiveness of antiallergy agents (histamine H1 antagonists (e.g. Azeptin®, Alesion®),15 leukotriene antagonists (e.g. Onon®, Acolate®, Kipres®, Singulair®)16, 27 and suplatast tosilate (IPD®).17 As the preventive effect on airway inflammation and remodelling of these agents has not been fully confirmed, they should ideally be used in combination with inhaled steroids at the moment. In patients who are not adherent to inhaled steroids, an antiallergy drug as mono-therapy may be considered. Case reports have also described effectiveness of other antiallergy agents. Treatment primarily with inhaled steroids rapidly improves cough in most patients, and a step down in therapy is possible, but as in classic asthma, symptoms (cough) often recur if treatment is discontinued.26 3.1.6.3 Patients with acute exacerbations or coughing induced by inhaled steroids (suggesting inadequate control). A short course of treatment with an oral steroid (e.g. prednisolone (Predonine®) 20–30 mg/day for 3–7 days) may be added. Note: Cough-predominant asthma. In so-called cough-predominant asthma, cough is the major symptom but mild wheezing is also present.28 The only difference between cough-predominant asthma and cough-variant asthma is the presence or absence of mild wheezing, but clinical manifestations, pathophysiology and treatment are similar. In clinical practice, these disorders need not be discriminated from each other. However, the concept of a single ‘asthmatic syndrome’,29 which includes not only cough-variant asthma but atopic cough and eosinophilic bronchitis, which have different pathophysiology and prognosis, may be misleading. Atopic cough is a new disorder whose pathogenesis has been investigated since first being reported in 1989 by Fujimura et al.6, 7, 30-36 An ‘atopic predisposition’ signifies a predisposition to past, present, or future development of an allergic disorder. It does not mean production of IgE antibodies in the more narrow sense. 3.2.2.1 Symptoms, age group, gender, time of cough episodes, triggers of cough episodes.29 A non-productive scratchy (tickle) cough in the throat (larynx and trachea) is the only symptom. Patients may feel like sputum is sticking in their throat. Patients of all ages seen by internal medicine may be affected, but the incidence is higher in women, especially middle-age women. Coughing is most frequent at bedtime, followed by late at night to early morning, upon awakening and early morning. Cough can be induced by many triggers, including cold air (air conditioners), warm air, conversation, talking on the phone, passive smoking, exercise and perfumes. 3.2.2.2 Atopic predisposition.30 Past medical and family history are often positive for atopic disorders other than asthma. Peripheral eosinophil counts, serum total IgE and specific IgE antibodies suggesting an atopic predisposition may be present, but using these alone for screening purposes is generally not useful. Table 2.6 compares the pathogenesis of atopic cough with asthma, cough-variant asthma and eosinophilic bronchitis without asthma.37 3.2.3.1 Physiological features. Airway reversibility with bronchodilators is the same as in normal controls.32 In other words, the tonus of bronchial smooth muscle is normal. There is also no increase in airway responsiveness.32 Diurnal variations in PEF are within normal limits. Cough reflex sensitivity is increased but becomes normal with treatment and improvement in cough.6 3.2.3.2 Pathological features. Eosinophils are present in induced sputum samples in 80–90% of patients.33 However, the number of eosinophils is less than in cough-variant asthma and asthma. Most patients have eosinophilic infiltration in the tracheal or bronchial submucosal tissue,34, 35 but the extent of infiltration is mild compared with cough-variant asthma and asthma.8 Analysis of BAL fluid shows the absence of eosinophila.34, 35 This suggests that in atopic cough, eosinophilic inflammation does not involve the peripheral airways, a finding quite different than in cough-variant asthma.8 Table 2.7 shows patient selection criteria for atopic cough in a clinical study, and Table 2.8 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. In cough-variant asthma not treated with anti-inflammatory agents, about 30% of patients will eventually develop asthma within a few years, but asthma does not occur in patients with atopic cough.7 However, if treatment is discontinued once cough improves, nearly 50% of patients will have a recurrent cough within 4 years.7 Longitudinal decline in pulmonary function is similar to that in healthy individuals.36 There is no progression to COPD. Bronchodilators are ineffective, but histamine H1 antagonists (e.g. azelastine HCl (Azeptin®), epinastine HCl (Alesion®), cetirizine HCl (Zyrtec®), fexofenadine HCl (Allegra®), olopatadine HCl (Allelock®)) may be effective.38 However, the efficacy rate is about 60%, and for complete relief of cough, steroid treatment is often required. In cases of severe atopic cough, bronchial biopsy shows more intense eosinophilic infiltration than in milder cases.35 If severe cough makes treatment with inhaled steroids difficult, administration of oral steroids (e.g. Predonine® 20–30 mg/day) for 1–2 weeks, as in cough-variant asthma and asthma, can provide relief of cough. Eosinophilic bronchitis without asthma (EB) is ‘pathologically similar to asthma with eosinophilia in morning sputum samples, but is physiologically different from asthma without an increase in airway responsiveness.37 EB was not initially proposed as a distinct entity and aroused some controversy on the relation between eosinophilic airway inflammation and increased airway responsiveness. The effectiveness of bronchodilators in patients with cough as the only symptom has not been established, and some cases may overlap with cough-variant asthma (Fig. 2.3).39 Diagnosis of eosinophilic airway presenting with cough based on airway responsiveness and effects of bronchodilator therapy (cough-variant asthma, atopic cough, and eosinophilic bronchitis without asthma).41 There are no gender differences in incidence of EB, but details on the time and triggers of cough episodes are unclear. Cough was originally described as productive, but many patients have non-productive cough. Fifty-six per cent of patients have rhinitis (mainly allergic rhinitis),40 11% have peripheral eosinophilia, and 22% are positive for specific IgE antibodies.41 Improvement in pulmonary function (mainly FEV1) with inhaled β2 agonists (so-called airway reversibility) occurs in less than 12% of patients.41 The methacholine PC20-FEV1 in most cases is within normal limits (142 ± 119 mg/mL (mean ± SD); range: 4.8 to >256 mg/mL).41 Diurnal variation in PEF is 7.2 ± 5.9%, a value similar to that in cough-variant asthma. Cough reflex sensitivity is increased but may normalize after treatment.42 The pathogenesis of EB includes sputum eosinophilia, and eosinophilia is present in 100% of spontaneous or induced sputum samples. The degree of eosinophilia is similar to that in stable asthma43 but less than in acute attacks.37 Histopathological examination of biopsied bronchial mucosa reveals eosinophilic infiltration in the intraepithelium and subepithelial mucosa; subepithelial basement membrane thickening is also present. The severity of findings is similar to that in asthma.44 In addition, the extent of submucosal T lymphocyte, mast cell and macrophage infiltration is similar to that in asthma. The degree of BAL fluid eosinophilia is also similar to that in asthma patients.43, 44 Sinobronchial syndrome is characterized by chronic and recurrent neutrophilic infiltration of the upper and lower airways.45 Inflammation in the upper respiratory tract resembles that in rhinosinusitis. In the lower respiratory tract, inflammation is classified in three categories as chronic bronchitis, bronchiectasis and diffuse panbrochiolitis. SBS typically presents with a chronic productive cough and is important in the differential diagnosis of patients with chronic cough. The exact aetiology of SBS is unknown, but various disorders and conditions with impaired mucus ciliary clearance and immunodeficiency (e.g. primary ciliary dyskinesia, Ig deficiency) often present with clinical features of SBS. Thus, SBS is probably associated with some dysfunction of the airway defence mechanism. Table 2.9 lists the clinical features of SBS. In many cases, there is development or worsening of a productive cough after upper respiratory inflammation. Other sinusitis-like symptoms, including nasal discharge, postnasal drip and throat clearing, are common. Physical examination of the nose and throat may confirm a postnasal drip. Examination of sputum inflammatory cells reveals many neutrophils, and H. influenzae, Pneumococcus and M. catarrhalis are often isolated on sputum culture. Treatment for dry cough (e.g. central cough suppressants, bronchodilators, histamine H1 antagonists, inhaled steroids, histamine H2 antagonists, PPIs) is usually not effective in cough due to SBS. Stringent criteria for diagnosis of SBS requires demonstration of neutrophilic inflammation in both the upper airway (sinusitis) and lower airway. Table 2.10 shows diagnostic criteria for a clinical study, and Table 2.11 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. Sinus imaging studies are useful to detect sinusitis. The presence of neutrophils in a nasal smear is important in confirming neutrophilic inflammation of the upper airway.46 Similarly, the presence of alveolar macrophages and many neutrophils in sputum is important in confirming neutrophilic inflammation of the lower airway.47, 48 In mild SBS with only scant production of serous or mucoid sputum, an expectorant (mucoregulatory/mucus normalizing) like l-carbocisteine (Mucodyne®) 1500 mg/day as mono-therapy may be effective, but treatment with a 14-member ring macrolide alone or in combination with an expectorant is more common. The 14-member ring macrolides have anti-inflammatory effects in a broad sense, including improvement of airway mucus/ciliary clearance,49, 50 inhibition of excess fluid and mucus secretion from airway epithelial cells,51, 52 and inhibition of neutrophil accumulation in airway mucosa.53 Specific 14-member ring macrolides and doses include erythromycin (Erythrocin®): 300–600 mg/day, clarithromycin (Clarith®, Klaricid®): 200–400 mg/day and roxithromycin (Rulid®): 150–300 mg/day for 2–12 weeks. In some cases, the 15-member ring macrolide azithromycin (Zithromac®) may be effective, but optimal dose and duration require further investigation. Adding a low dose of a quinolone to a macrolide antibiotic may reduce sputum volume in a shorter time,54 but indiscriminate use can induce the emergence of quinolone-resistant organisms. Therefore, quinolones should be limited to patients who fail to adequately respond to treatment with macrolides and expectorants. A respiratory quinolone such as levofloxacin (Cravit®), tosufloxacin (Ozex®), or gatifloxacin (Gatiflo®) can be prescribed at adequate doses for up to 2 weeks. Gastro-esophageal reflux (GER) is the regurgitation of harmful substances like gastric acid and pepsin from the stomach into the esophagus, and the symptoms and complications due to GER are called GERD. The occurrence of various respiratory tract complications due to GERD has long been known.55 One of the major respiratory tract complications due to GERD is chronic cough. In Western countries, GERD plays a role in 38–82% of patients with chronic cough.56-62 Two primary mechanisms are thought to be involved in cough due to GERD. One is the ‘reflex mechanism’, in which GER stimulates vagal nerve endings in the lower esophagus, with development of cough mediated through the vagal reflex.63 The other is the ‘micro aspiration mechanism’, in which GER causes micro aspiration of gastric contents into the trachea and bronchi, with development of cough due to direct stimulation of airway smooth muscle and irritant receptors.64 Another proposed mechanism is the ‘cough-reflux self-perpetuating cycle’, in which GER develops due to cough, which in turn then worsens coughing.65-69 Coughing due to GERD is usually chronic, with a mean duration of 13–58 months.56, 60, 70 Some patients have symptoms of GER such as heartburn that precede cough. In other patients, only cough is present, without other GER symptoms.56, 60, 70 In suspected cases of cough due to GERD, conventional treatment for cough (e.g. central cough suppressants, bronchodilators, histamine H1 antagonists, inhaled steroids, antibiotics) is not effective. In addition, the medical history, physical examination, CXR, sinus X-rays, pulmonary function tests, airway responsiveness tests and PEF monitoring may not suggest any cause. In general clinical practice, patients with suspected cough due to GERD can be treated with a histamine H2 antagonist or PPI. A response to treatment suggests a clinical diagnosis of GERD-related cough.65 To confirm a diagnosis of GERD-related cough, 24-h esophageal pH monitoring is recommended.71 In general, esophageal pH is less than 4 in GER, and if cough develops with an esophageal pH of 4 or less, cough due to GERD is likely. If treatment with a PPI improves the GER and cough, the diagnosis is confirmed72 (Fig. 2.4). As compared with 24-h esophageal pH monitoring, the detection sensitivity of upper GI endoscopy for GER is lower, but endoscopy is still recommended to exclude, for example, obstruction due to esophageal cancer, achalasia, or Barrett’s esophagus. Table 2.12 shows patient selection criteria for GERD-related cough in a clinical study, and Table 2.13 shows simplified diagnostic criteria for use in general clinical settings. Results of 24-h esophageal pH monitoring in cough due to gastro-esophageal reflux. (a) Cough develop with esophageal pH below 4 due to gastro-esophageal reflux, and (b) administration of a proton pump inhibitor maintains esophageal pH above 4, with a resolution of cough.72 The cornerstone of treatment for GERD is pharmacotherapy. Treatment that includes a histamine H2 antagonist is effective in 80–100% of cases, but long-term administration is required to improve cough (mean: 161–179 days).65 With a PPI, cough may improve in as little as 2 weeks,68, 73 but the recommended duration of treatment is at least 4 weeks. In patients who fail to respond to a histamine H2 antagonist or PPI, surgical fundoplication is effective in 86–100% of cases.74, 75 Angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors are widely prescribed as first-line treatment in hypertension. ACE inhibitors are excellent in terms of cardio-protective, reno-protective and minimal effects on glucose and lipid metabolism, but dry cough is a common adverse reaction. The incidence of cough varies with the type of ACE inhibitor but is not related to dose.76 The incidence of cough is 10–30% and tends to be higher in middle-age women.65 The mechanism of cough is as follows. ACE inhibitors block kininase II and NEP, which are enzymes involved in bradykinin and substance P degradation. The local increase in bradykinin and substance P concentrations stimulate C-fibres, cough receptors.77 In addition, ACE inhibitors block the degradation of prostaglandins, which may stimulate C-fibres and induce cough. Angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor-related cough is usually a persistent dry cough that begins a few weeks after, rather than right after, starting therapy. Bronchodilators and central cough suppressants have no effect. Most patients are unaware that their antihypertensive drug may be the cause of coughing. Therefore, a detailed medical history and review of records is essential regarding use of ACE inhibitors. Another important point is that some patients without a cough while initially on an ACE inhibitor can later develop a persistent cough that is first triggered, for example, by a common cold. Cough usually resolves within 1 week after discontinuing ACE inhibitors. If an ACE inhibitor cannot be safely discontinued, consideration should be given to switching to an angiotensin II receptor antagonist, which does not induce cough. The conventional definition of chronic bronchitis is ‘a condition with chronic cough and sputum production due to chronic airway inflammation, associated with smoking and air pollution, not due to another cardiopulmonary or ENT cause, with symptoms on most days for 3 months during 2 consecutive years’.78 In many countries including Japan, however, air pollution is decreasing, and chronic bronchitis more often refers to ‘simple chronic bronchitis’ due to smoking, but without airway obstruction; in other words, ‘smoker’s bronchitis’. In addition, the period of ‘3 months in 2 consecutive years’ was established in the 1960s as social diagnostic criteria in connection with compensation benefits to mail carriers in London who suffered from respiratory symptoms due to smog. However, there was no good medical justification. Therefore, the period of ‘3 months in 2 consecutive years’ is no longer strictly adhered to in diagnosing chronic bronchitis. At present, the three important diagnostic criteria for chronic bronchitis are: (1) current smoker; (2) productive cough; and (3) improvement with cessation of smoking (Table 2.14). The cornerstone of treatment of cough in chronic bronchitis is smoking cessation. Cough resolves or improves in 90% or more of patients who quit smoking, and in more than 50%, the cough resolves within 1 month.79 If cough, sputum production or dyspnoea continue after smoking is stopped, treatment with anticholinergic drugs, bronchodilators (e.g. β2 agonists) and expectorants may be indicated. Cough in postnasal drip is productive. Causes of postnasal drip include sinusitis, acute rhinitis, allergic rhinitis and vasomotor rhinitis. In Western countries, postnasal drip syndrome is one of the major causes of chronic cough of unknown aetiology, and Irwin et al. reported that postnasal drip was the cause in 41% of cases.80 In Japan, 80–84% of patients with sinusitis have postnasal drip, and of these, 28–41% also have a cough. The mechanism of cough involves (i) acute and chronic laryngitis and bronchitis due to postnasal drip; and (ii) direct chemical and physical stimulation of cough receptors in the larynx and trachea by postnasal drip. Use of a tongue depressor and visualization of the posterior wall of the oropharynx, or examination by posterior rhinoscopy, will confirm the presence of postnasal drip. The diagnosis of postnasal drip can also be made by nasopharyngeal fibroscopy. Sinus X-rays and CT are useful in diagnosing sinusitis.81 On cytological examination of nasal discharge, a predominance of neutrophils suggests infectious sinusitis, whereas a predominance of eosinophils suggests allergic rhinitis. Treatment is directed at the underlying cause. The use of macrolide antibiotics in chronic sinusitis, or antiallergy and antihistamine drugs in allergic rhinitis, resolves or improves the postnasal drip and cough. Persistent dry cough after an upper respiratory infection, usually a viral infection, is common in middle-age and older adults, especially women.82 In 1998, an ACCP consensus report stated that 11–25% of chronic coughs were post-infectious cough.65 Furthermore, during outbreaks of Mycoplasma and pertussis, this rate increased to 25–50%.65 The mechanism of post-infectious cough is not well understood. However, clinical and experiment studies have reported a decrease in NEP activity (a substance P degradation enzyme) and histamine degradation enzyme activity.83 The diagnosis of post-infectious cough is clinical, including: (i) a previous common cold and (ii) exclusion of another cause of chronic cough. In most cases, the cough improves spontaneously. If the cough is prolonged, evaluation for another cause of chronic cough such as bronchial asthma or postnasal drip is recommended. Psychogenic cough, also known as habitual cough, was first reported in Western countries in the 1960s.84 The cough is often triggered by a common cold, with repetitive episodes, like a dog barking or a foghorn. The cough is loud, but not serious, and usually disappears during sleep. Even though coughing may interfere with daily and work activities, there is often some other ‘secondary gain’.65 Psychogenic cough occurs mostly in children and adolescents, with a slightly greater incidence in boys. Although rare in adults, it occurs more in women. The diagnosis of psychogenic cough is one of exclusion, after ruling out an organic or functional cause of cough. Antitussives are usually ineffective. Psychiatric referral is often necessary, including treatment with minor tranquilizers, support and encouragement, behaviour modification, psychotherapy, counselling and hypnosis. Chronic cough is considered a common symptom in lung cancer, but in actuality, only 0–2% of patients with lung cancer present with chronic cough as their only symptom.76 The mechanism of cough is probably stimulation of cough receptors in the bronchial lumen. In lung cancer patients without cough, the tumours are often located peripherally, where there are few cough receptors.81 In addition, many lung cancer patients are smokers, and some experts believe that cough is due mainly to chronic bronchitis associated with smoking. CXR is performed in suspected lung cancer, but care should be taken, because abnormal findings may be absent in patients with central airway tumours or those near the mediastinum. In smokers with refractory cough, sputum cytology and bronchoscopy should be performed. In goblet cell type carcinoma, excessive mucin production and bronchorrhoea may cause severe coughing. Tracheobronchial tuberculosis usually presents with severe cough and wheezing. Other symptoms may include hoarseness, dyspnoea and bloody sputum. As compared with pulmonary tuberculosis, tracheobronchial tuberculosis is more common in younger people, with a two to three times higher incidence in women than in men. In patients evaluated for refractory cough but normal findings on CXR, tracheobronchial tuberculosis should always be kept in mind. The mechanism of infection may include (i) direct infection of the bronchial mucosa; (ii) direct spread from a pulmonary lesion; (iii) bronchial perforation by adjacent lymph nodes; and (iv) haematogenous spread. In cases where M. tuberculosis cannot be identified by sputum smears and cultures, bronchoscopy should be performed, with examination of sputum aspirates for M. tuberculosis or histopathological examination of biopsy specimens for necrosis and epithelioid cell granulomas. The three cardinal symptoms of a foreign body in the airway are (i) cough; (ii) wheezing; and (iii) dyspnoea. Airway foreign bodies in young children often include peanuts, almonds and beans, whereas in adults, dentures and crowns are more common. In a study of 25 patients with refractory cough for at least 3 weeks, a normal CXR and pulmonary function tests, and no improvement with empirical therapy, bronchoscopy revealed abnormal findings in eight patients, including two with broncholiths.85 A thorough medical history is essential in diagnosing an airway foreign body. An opaque foreign body is easy to identify on X-ray, but a non-opaque foreign body is difficult to detect. Decreased breath sounds or wheezing on physical examination may help in diagnosis. Bronchoscopy is often required to remove airway foreign bodies. Interstitial lung disease is characterized by inflammatory and fibrotic lesions of the lung interstitium. The lesions are varied, and almost 130 such disorders have been identified. This includes interstitial pneumonitis, in which patients with acute and chronic disease often have a chief complaint of dry cough; cough is present in 50–70% of cases. Cough in interstitial lung disease typically occurs with deep inspiration or changes in body position. The mechanism of cough is thought to involve stimulation of peripheral airway cough receptors or alveolar stretch receptors, but the details remain unknown. Interstitial lung disease is relatively easy to diagnose by CXR, CT and pulmonary function testing. Treatment of cough is aimed at the underlying disease, but interstitial lung disease is often refractory to treatment. Bronchorrhoea refers to copious secretion of serous sputum greater than 100 mL/day. Bronchorrhoea has been reported in bronchial asthma, goblet cell type carcinomas, bronchial tuberculosis and idiopathic disorders, with a higher incidence in the first two disorders. The sputum has an egg-white appearance, is foamy with low viscosity, and is easily separated into gel and sol layers. Patients with bronchorrhoea have severe cough with copious sputum, and activities of daily living are impaired due to airway obstruction. The mechanism of excessive secretion in bronchial asthma includes: (i) fluid secretion from airway epithelial cells associated with active ion transport; (ii) mucin secretion from goblet cells and bronchial gland cells; and (iii) effusion of serous fluid due to increased vascular permeability. Bronchorrhoea is not a diagnosis but a symptom, and treatment of the underlying disorder is important, including reduction of sputum production. Chronic cough is a symptom in many types of respiratory disorders. These include pertussis, Mycoplasma pneumonia, Chlamydial pneumonia and bronchial tuberculosis, but in patients with chronic cough lasting 8 weeks or longer, eradication of pathogens with antibiotic treatment is a reasonable assumption. Of course, lack of a diagnosis and no appropriate treatment, or a mistaken diagnosis and ineffective treatment, does occur in some cases, but in patients with a correct diagnosis who receive antimicrobial therapy, the infection should be completely eradicated by 8 weeks. However, even with a correct diagnosis and appropriate treatment, cough can persist in some cases. Despite resolution of generalized symptoms such as fever and improvement of X-ray findings and inflammatory parameters, the cough may linger. This is particularly true in pertussis and Mycoplasma pneumonia. In these types of cases, long-term indiscriminate use of antibiotics sometimes occurs. When cough is the only lingering symptom after pertussis or Mycoplasma pneumonia, a secondary cause other than the pathogen, for example, an immunocompromised state, should be suspected. There are conflicting reports on whether cough sensitivity and airway responsiveness are increased in pertussis and Mycoplasma pneumonia.86, 87 Continued cough, however, may be caused by non-specific allergic inflammation of the airways, or by increased mucous production despite a decreased inflammatory response to the pathogen. In patients in whom cough becomes chronic. further evaluation for another cause is appropriate. Antibiotics are no longer effective, and long-term indiscriminate use is not recommended.

papers.title: Hyperventilation Syndrome in Adolescent Athletes
papers.abstract: In brief: Ten high school students (three males, seven females) hyperventilated 12 times during athletic events over a two-year period. Symptoms associated with hyperventilation syndrome include an inability to catch one's breath, rapid deep respirations, anxiety (often associated with losing among athletes), tetany, numbness of lips and hands, chest pain, and even loss of consciousness. Treatment may consist of rebreathing into a paper bag, which is embarrassing in front of observers, or slowly inhaling through the nose and exhaling through the mouth.

papers.title: Schizoaffektive Störungen
papers.abstract: Schizoaffektive Erkrankungen sind zwar ein nosologisches Ärgernis, aber eine klinische Realität. Sehr viele Menschen sind davon betroffen. Man geht davon aus, dass 20–30 % aller sog. „endogenen Psychosen” als schizoaffektiv zu bezeichnen sind. Es sind lebenslange Erkrankungen, die von einer hohen Suizidalität begleitet werden. Obwohl ihre Therapie komplizierter ist als bei den „reinen Formen” (wie etwa Schizophrenien oder affektive Erkrankungen), haben sie eine deutlich günstigere Prognose als die Schizophrenien, aber eine etwas schlechtere als die affektiven Erkrankungen. Sie verlaufen in der Regel polyphasisch und sie benötigen eine praktisch lebenslange Betreuung.

papers.title: Policondrite recidivante associada a meningoencefalite: relato de caso
papers.abstract: Policondrite é entidade com acometimento recorrente de qualquer cartilagem, principalmente nasal e auricular, apresenta evolução progressiva e recorrente. Está raramente associada a afecção do sistema nervoso. Descrevemos um paciente cuja manifestação inicial foi de meningoencefalite, com posterior recorrência do quadro seguido de condrite auricular e nasal. Essa associação distingue-se pela raridade e pelo fato de que o quadro neurológico antecedeu a policondrite. Seu reconhecimento permitiu o tratamento adequado e evolução satisfatória com corticosteróides e methotrexato.

papers.title: Wysiękowe zapalenie ucha środkowego (OMS)
papers.abstract: Otitis media with effusion (OME) is characterized by the presence of fluid in the middle ear, without general and local signs and symptoms of acute inflammation and tympanic membrane perforation. In younger children (<3 years of age) is usually preceded by an episode of acute otitis media. However older children (>3 years of age) usually have no recent history suggestive of acute otitis media, albeit they usually suffer because of recurrent upper respiratory tract infections. OME has multifactorial etiology with predominant role of bacterial infection of middle ear cavity and Eustachian tube dysfunction making proper aeration of tympanic cavity impossible. OME presents great tendency for spontaneous resolution, however recurrent episodes are quite common (about 30–40% of children) and in 5–10% of cases the disease persist up to one year and longer. Chronic cases (≥3 months) are more likely to persist further. Diagnosis is based mainly on otoscopy, tympanometry and pure tone audiometry. Ventilation tube insertion is recommended for children with persistent bilateral OME documented over the period of at least 3 months with hearing level in the better ear of 25–30 dB (PTA 0.5, 1, 2, 4 kHz) or worse. Exceptionally, the intervention should be considered earlier for children with known risk factors for developmental difficulties, with hearing loss >40 dB in better hearing ear or with retraction pockets of tympanic membrane. Adenoidectomy may be considered appropriate in children >4 years of age with concomitant upper respiratory tract symptoms.

papers.title: chang dao wei sheng tai yu chang yi ji zong he zheng xiang guan xing de yan jiu
papers.abstract: 肠易激综合征(irritable bowel syndrome,IBS)是一种常见的功能性消化系统疾病,其临床特点是腹痛、腹胀等腹部不适伴大便性状和(或)大便次数改变,但无明确大体形态学、组织学、微生物学或生化代谢异常可查的临床综合征。其国外发病率为10%~15%[1],国内流行病学调查报道其发病率为5.60%[2]。IBS症状呈慢性、反复发作,同时还常伴有多种肠道外症状表现,如兴趣缺乏、情绪低落、心烦、失眠等精神状态的改变。
papers.venue: Medical Journal of Trauma and Disability

papers.title: Irritable bowel syndrome
papers.abstract: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a chronic, relapsing, and often life-long disorder of no identifiable cause that affects the digestive system. It is known by a variety of names, including spastic colon, spastic colitis, mucous colitis, nervous diarrhoea and nervous bowel. It is the most commonly diagnosed gastrointestinal condition worldwide, affecting an estimated 10-20% of the general population, and is second only to the common cold as a cause of absence from work.

papers.title: Rezidivierende Harnwegsinfektionen: ein Fallbericht
papers.abstract: Rezidivierende Harnwegsinfektionen ­betreffen u.a. aufgrund der kürzeren Harnwege primär Frauen. Rezidivierend heißt ≥ 2 symptomatische Episoden pro Halbjahr oder ≥ 3 pro Jahr. Die Inzidenz ist altersabhängig. Therapeutisch werden Antibiotika und eine ausreichende Flüssigkeitsaufnahme empfohlen. Phytotherapie kann präventiv und im Krankheitsfall ergänzend zum Einsatz kommen.

papers.title: 走近“神秘杀手”——胃食管反流
papers.abstract: 当您在享受幸福生活的时候，是否知道有这样一些被痛苦折磨的人：他们可能会在平时或饭后出现烧心和反酸（胃内酸性液体逆流到食管或口腔的现象）；他们可能会在吃饭时、饭后、睡觉时或早起时出现轻重不等甚至剧烈的咳嗽、咳痰甚至哮喘样发作；他们可能会长期被不同程度的咽部异物感所困扰，

papers.title: Fenotipos de sibilância em idade pré-escolar. Factores de risco para  persistência, orientações para o diagnóstico e utilidade clínica
papers.abstract: A asma e a sibilância recorrente, nas suas diferentes expressoes fenotipicas, estao entre as patologias mais comuns em idade escolar, mas tambem entre as mais dificeis de abordar pela escassez de sintomatologia, que pode traduzir diferentes diagnosticos e sobretudo diferentes prognosticos. Nas ultimas decadas assistiu- se a uma grande evolucao do conhecimento, resultado em grande parte de estudos longitudinais, como o de Tucson, que permitiram a separacao de diferentes fenotipos de sibilância e a melhor compreensao dos diversos factores envolvidos: geneticos, ambientais e de desenvolvimento pulmonar e das vias aereas. Apesar da melhor caracterizacao fenotipica, a abordagem diagnostica e terapeutica da sibilância em idade pre-escolar mantem-se dificil, sobretudo na aplicacao individual do conhecimento. Trata-se duma entidade heterogenea, cujo prognostico a longo prazo varia desde a recuperacao total, na maior parte dos casos, ate ao diagnostico de asma ou perturbacao irreversivel da funcao pulmonar. Neste artigo reveem-se a epidemiologia da sibilância em idade pre-escolar, os fenotipos mais frequentemente utilizados e factores de risco, e enuncia-se a problematica da abordagem diagnostica no doente individual. Neste grupo etario, a sibilância recorrente ou persistente associada a atopia e com evolucao para asma e a sibilância precoce, transitoria associada a infeccoes virais, sao as formas mais frequentes de apresentacao e esta e a classificacao fenotipica que parece emergir com maior relevância na orientacao terapeutica e prognostica.
papers.venue: DOAJ (DOAJ: Directory of Open Access Journals)

papers.title: Thérapeutiques inhalées des pathologies bronchiques chroniques
papers.abstract: L’asthme est une maladie frequente qui touche plus de 4 millions de personnes en France. Ses premieres manifestations surviennent le plus souvent pendant l’enfance. L’asthme est caracterise par une dyspnee, une bronchoconstriction et une hypersecretion de mucus. La survenue d’un asthme resulte de l’association d’une predisposition genetique et de facteurs environnementaux dont notamment les allergenes interieurs et exterieurs, la fumee du tabac, et la pollution. La realisation d’epreuves fonctionnelles respiratoires est indispensable pour affirmer son diagnostic. L’asthme ne se guerit pas : il persiste toute la vie meme si des phases de remission peuvent durer plusieurs annees. Les traitements de fonds a base de corticoides inhalees, bronchodilatateurs adrenergique et anticholinergiques permettent de retablir un flux respiratoire adapte en fonction de la severite de l’asthme. Ils possedent peu d’effets indesirables aux doses minimales efficaces. La bronchopneumopathie chronique obstructive touchait il y a 20 ans 1,7 million de personnes en France, et de nos jours environ 3 millions. Cette maladie est plus frequente chez les fumeurs. On retrouve une inflammation des voies aeriennes (dont les bronches) qui provoque un epaississement des parois par atrophie des muscles lisses, ainsi qu’une hypersecretion reactionnelle de mucus. Les signes cliniques non specifiques (toux chronique, expectorations, essoufflement) necessitent la realisation d’une spirometrie pour etayer le diagnostic. Le controle de ces deux maladies repose sur un traitement de fond quotidien bien observe avec des corticoides inhales, des bronchodilatateurs adrenergiques et anticholinergiques choisis en fonction de la predominance des symptomes (dyspnee et/ou exacerbations), parfois en association. Le traitement de crise est reserve uniquement en cas de symptomes aigus. Il est en outre fondamental d’eliminer les facteurs declenchants de son environnement, pour limiter les crises ou exacerbations.

papers.title: A CASE REPORT ON CONGENITAL LOBAR EMPHYSEMA
papers.abstract: Congenital lobar emphysema (CLE) disorder is an uncommon respiratory issue in which air can enter the lungs yet cannot escape, bringing about over inflation (hyperinflation) of the projections of the lung with an incidence 1 per 20,000-30,000 per birth. It is frequently recognized in babies or youthful newborn children; however, a few cases do not get to be distinctly evident until adulthood. This issue might be sufficiently serious to bring about related heart issues. We report a case of a 1-month-old female infant who showed the signs and symptoms of this disease, but responded well to her treatment and was discharged in a stable state.
papers.venue: Asian Journal of Pharmaceutical and Clinical Research

papers.title: Ratunek dla nerek
papers.abstract: Ratunek dla nerek Az 18 proc. Polakow moze cierpiec na przewleklą chorobe nerek. To wyjątkowo podstepne schorzenie, bo nie boli. Pierwsze symptomy (bol plecow), jeśli w ogole wystąpią, wydają sie nieistotne i nie są kojarzone z nerkami. Gdy dojdzie do niewydolności tego narządu, ratunkiem pozostają dializy lub przeszczep.

papers.title: A foglalkozási nátha = Occupational rhinitis
papers.abstract:
A foglalkozasi natha (OR) az orr olyan gyulladasos betegsege, amelyet a munkahelyen eszlelhető valamilyen tenyező valt ki es a munkahelyen kivul semmi sem ront. Klinikai tunetei (nehezitett orrlegzes, orrvaladekozas, viszkető erzes, orron keresztuli legaramlas csokkenese) csaknem azonosak az egyeb okbol bekovetkező allergias nathaeval. A 27/1996. NM-rendelet szerint Magyarorszagon is bejelentesre kotelezett betegseg. Ennek ellenere 1997 es 2009 kozott hazankban egyetlen esetet sem jelentettek. A legutobbi 20 evben az egyetlen magyar nyelvű, OR-rel foglalkozo szakirodalom az Ungvary
 altal szerkesztett es 2004-ben megjelent Munkaegeszsegtan cimű tankonyv. E betegseg Europa tobbi orszagaban nem ismeretlen. Kivalthatjak mind nagy (1000 Dalton feletti), mind kis molekulasulyu anyagok. Pekek kozott peldaul 18–28%, izocianattal dolgozok (peldaul festők, ontodei munkasok) kozott 36–42% kozott irjak le a prevalenciajat. Kialakulasara hajlamosit, ha a karosito anyag nagy koncentracioban van a levegőben, illetve, ha tobbfajta karosito anyag van a levegőben. A meglevő atopia főleg a nagy molekulasulyu anyagok eseteben hajlamosito tenyező. Az OR korismejenek megallapitasahoz a kortorteneten kivul objektiv vizsgalatokat kell hasznalni. A legelfogadottabb a specifikus nasalis provokacio. Ennek soran gravimetriasan merhetjuk az orrvaladek mennyiseget, vizsgalhatjuk az orrvaladekban talalhato sejteket es citokineket, valamint az orron keresztuli legaramlast rhinomanometriaval es a nasalis belegzesi aramlast, az orr anatomiai viszonyainak megvaltozasat pedig akusztikus rhinometriaval. Az OR kezelese elsősorban munkahelyi feladat: fokozni a szellőztetest, csokkenteni az expozicios időt, helyettesiteni a karosito tenyezőt. Az ujonnan felvetteket evente szűrni, az OR-ben szenvedőket asztma iranyaban vizsgalni kell. Gyogyszeres kezeles: per os antihisztamin, nasalis szteroid, kombinalt hatasu (antihisztamin+membranstabilizalo) szemcsepp.
			 | 
				Occupational rhinitis (OR) is an inflammatory disease of the nose, which is characterized by intermittent or persistent symptoms, arising out of causes and conditions attributable to a particular work environment and not to stimuli encountered outside the workplace. Its clinical symptoms (nasal congestion, sneezing, rhinorrhea, itching, nasal airflow limitation) are very similar with the symptoms of the allergic rhinitis caused by other (classical) agents. According to the 27/1996 NM Departmental Order, OR in Hungary is a notifiable disease. Despite, between year 1997 and 2009, not even a single case was reported in Hungary. In the last 20 years the only Hungarian reference in this field was published in 2004, in the Textbook of Occupational Medicine, edited by Ungvary. This disease is not unknown in other European countries. It can be produced by both high and low molecular weight agents. For example, according to the publications, its prevalence among bakers can be 18–29%, and among workers with diisocyanates (painters, urethane mould workers) 36–42%. Risk factors are atopy, high concentration and multiple irritant agents in the air of workplace. Atopy has been associated with an increased risk of specific sensitization to a variety of HMW agents. Beside of the clinical and occupational history, objective investigations have to be used as well, for the diagnosis of OR. The gold standard for confirming the diagnosis of OR is the nasal provocation test. Objective methods that can be used for assessing nasal patency during the investigation of OR include rhinomanometry, acoustic rhinometry, peak nasal inspiratory flow, and gravimetry of the nasal secret. The management of the OR needs environmental interventions. These are: increasing the ventilation, decreasing the time of exposure, substitution of the irritant agent, investigation of possible asthma in all workers with OR. Medical treatments are: oral antihistamines, local (nasal) corticosteroids, combined (antihistamine+membran stabilizer) eyedrops.

papers.title: Hiperplasia benigna de próstata
papers.abstract: Consideraciones previas La HPB se define solo en términos histológicos. El tamaño de la glándula prostática normal es de 20-30 cc (o 20-30 g). Aumenta con la edad y puede provocar síntomas en el tracto urinario inferior: – Obstructivos: flujo de orina débil y/o intermitente, sensación de vaciado incompleto de la vejiga, micción doble (antes de 2 h), goteo posmiccional, dificultad o demora al comenzar la micción, retención de orina. – Irritativos: micción frecuente o con urgencia, nicturia. Los objetivos terapéuticos son mejorar la calidad de vida disminuyendo los síntomas y evitar el tratamiento quirúrgico. Se recomienda usar la escala IPSS para decidir la actitud terapéutica: no farmacológico si 0-7 puntos y farmacológico si ≥8 puntos. Antes de iniciar el tratamiento farmacológico, sustituir o reducir los fármacos que empeoren los síntomas (anticolinérgicos, diuréticos y simpaticomiméticos). Se debe considerar el tratamiento quirúrgico cuando los síntomas son graves o aparecen complicaciones derivadas de la obstrucción (retención aguda, infecciones recurrentes, residuo posmiccional >200 mL, divertículos vesicales, hematuria o IR).

papers.title: GGD-richtlijn medische milieukunde : Smog en gezondheid
papers.abstract: Het RIVM heeft, in opdracht van het ministerie van VWS, met de GGD'en de richtlijn 'Smog en gezondheid' ontwikkeld. Hiermee is de 'GGD-richtlijn smog' uit 2004 herzien. De richtlijn geeft GGD'en informatie over smog, smogregelgeving, effecten op de gezondheid en maatregelen om gezondheidseffecten te voorkomen. Bij smog is gedurende een korte periode van enkele uren of dagen sprake van hoge concentraties luchtverontreiniging door ozon, fijn stof of stikstofdioxide. In ons land komt smog steeds minder voor, maar bij stabiel helder weer met lage windsnelheden kan het zich zowel 's zomers als 's winters voordoen. Gezondheidsklachten van smog Door smog kunnen acute gezondheidsklachten ontstaan, vooral bij mensen met chronische long- en/of hart- en vaatziekten, ouderen en kinderen. Het gaat hierbij om klachten aan de luchtwegen, zoals hoesten, piepen en kortademigheid. Ook kunnen bestaande chronische long- of hart- en vaatziekten erdoor verergeren. Bij smog door ozon kan bovendien irritatie van ogen, neus of keel ontstaan. Al deze klachten zijn meestal tijdelijk. Bij mensen met al bestaande long-, hart- of vaatziekten kan smog leiden tot een ziekenhuisopname en zelfs tot sterfte. Ook mensen die veel inspanning leveren en daardoor meer (verontreinigde) lucht inademen, zoals sporters en kinderen die buiten spelen, lopen een groter risico op gezondheidsklachten. Ernstige smog kan bij iedereen klachten veroorzaken. Gedragsadviezen Klachten kunnen het beste worden voorkomen door de blootstelling aan smog te verminderen. Dit kan door zware inspanning te vermijden. Bij smog door ozon, wat zich alleen in de zomermaanden voordoet, kan de blootstelling ook worden verminderd door 's middags en in de vroege avond binnen te blijven.

papers.title: Líquen escleroso vulvar na criança: um diagnóstico a ter em mente
papers.abstract: O liquen escleroso e uma dermatose inflamatoria, que pode aparecer em qualquer idade e com marcada preponderância pela regiao genital. Trata-se de uma entidade relativamente frequente, sobretudo no genero feminino, ainda que muito pouco reconhecida pela maior parte dos clinicos. Pode ser totalmente assintomatico ou, no outro extremo, responsavel por quadros de prurido e/ou ardor com marcada interferencia com a qualidade de vida. A obstipacao e uma manifestacao unica das criancas. As hemorragias sao frequentes, pela fragilidade cutânea, diferentemente do que se verifica em mulheres adultas. A sua apresentacao em idade infantil gera frequentemente confusao com quadros de abuso sexual, com todas as implicacoes dai decorrentes. Pode ter como consequencia a curto e medio prazo uma destruicao da normal anatomia vulvar e, por vezes, anal. A longo prazo acarreta um risco acrescido de carcinoma vulvar. O correcto e atempado tratamento pode evitar as sequelas desta afeccao, embora nao se conheca o seu impacto sobre o risco de malignidade. Os corticoides topicos sao o tratamento de primeira linha. Habitualmente esta entidade surge num ambiente pessoal e familiar carregado de doencas e fenomenos auto-imunes. Especulou-se que a maior parte dos casos surgidos na infância entrariam em remissao, sem sequelas, apos a menarca. Hoje, contudo, sabe-se nao ser essa a realidade. Salienta-se a necessidade de abordagens e colaboracao multidisciplinares, incluindo clinicos gerais, pediatras, ginecologistas, urologistas e dermatologistas. Os autores abordam a epidemiologia, sinais e sintomas, o papel da biopsia, complicacoes, seguimento, prognostico e tratamento do liquen escleroso vulvar em criancas.

papers.title: A Simple Splint for Trigger Finger
papers.abstract: Trigger finger, idiopathic or secondary to diabetes and inflammatory arthritis, is a common clinical condition in hand surgery. There is a 2.4% life-time risk of developing trigger finger in the general population.[1] Though it may not be debilitating, it can be associated with pain and locking episodes which warrant active interventions apart from analgesics and anti-inflammatory medications. Management of this common problem depends on the grading as suggested by Quinnell.[2]

papers.title: Gilbert’s-, Arias’- or a still unknown syndrome - chronic icterus in a Norwegian Fjord Horse
papers.abstract: Einleitung Der Ikterus ist ein bei verschieden Erkrankungen auftretendes Symptom.Als chronisches Geschehen beim Pferd wurde der Ikterus von Divers (1983) und Schusser et al. (2007) beschrieben.Die zunächst offensichtlichen Verfärbungen der Schleimhäute werden durch eine erhöhte Konzentration von Bilirubin verursacht, einem Abbauprodukt des roten Blutfarbstoffs Hämoglobin.Die Lebenszeit der zirkulierenden Erythrozyten beträgt etwa 150 Tage (Sellon 2004).Danach werden sie in der Milz abgebaut.Aus dem Hämoglobin,

papers.title: 健康从“刷牙”开始
papers.abstract: 不管到什么时候,为了爱犬的身体健康着想,非常有必要为它做各种各样的护理。刷牙就是其中的一项。患上牙周病不仅仅会出现口臭、牙疼的现象,而且这种引发牙周病的病菌会渗入到骨头,造成骨质疏松;更严重的会渗入到皮肤,致使皮肤溃烂。另外,牙周病还有可能引发肝脏、肾脏和心脏方面的疾病。为了爱犬的健康,必须要为它进行牙齿的护理。

papers.title: Cortisol-induced hypertension in Cushing's syndrome
papers.abstract: Cushing's syndrome is caused by the excessive secretion of cortisol from the adrenal cortex.Hypertension is one of the most distinguishing features of Cushing's syndrome,as it is present in about 80% of adult patients.The various pathogenetic mechanisms that have been proposed for the development of cortisol-induced hypertension in Cushing's syndrome and its management are discussed.

papers.title: Otite moyenne aiguë de l’enfant – Données 2011
papers.abstract: L’otite moyenne aigue (OMA) est l’une des infections bacteriennes les plus communes chez l’enfant, surtout avant 3 ans, l’une des causes de consultation les plus frequentes a cet âge, conduisant souvent a la prescription d’antibiotiques. Les couts induits directs – depenses de sante – et indirects – temps de travail perdu – en font un fardeau important. L’utilisation frequente des antibiotiques est par ailleurs source de resistances, qui entrainent de moins bons resultats therapeutiques. Plusieurs etudes ont montre il y a quelques annees que l’antibiotherapie n’etait pas toujours necessaire et que le « systematique » pouvait souvent laisser place a une « strategie d’attente ». Cependant, des etudes recentes ont semble remettre en cause ce principe, ce qui necessite cette mise a jour des donnees disponibles. Plus de 8 enfants sur 10 font au moins un episode d’otite moyenne aigue avant 1 an, avec des recurrences frequentes jusqu’a 7 ans, ce qui pose des problemes toujours difficiles. Rappelons que de nombreux facteurs personnels, infectieux, allergiques et environnementaux contribuent au developpement de l’OMA et que des interventions preventives simples sont toujours possibles et souhaitables.

papers.title: Otolaryngologic presentation of Tic‐like disorders
papers.abstract: Abstract Common otolaryngologic symptoms such as coughing and sneezing may not be manifestations of disease of the upper respiratory tract. Two cases are reported in which these symptoms were the first evidence of tic‐like disorders. A short discussion of one such disorder, Gilles de la Tourette's syndrome, is presented. The entity of paroxysmal smeezing is also mentioned. It is pointed out that, in the absence of otolaryngologic disease, these disorders may first present to an otolaryngologist for diagnosis.

papers.title: 针灸临床讲座（1） 周围性面神经麻痹
papers.abstract: 周围性面神经麻痹（也称Bell麻痹），是指面神经核以下病变所致的周围性面瘫，常发生于一侧。此病多见，可发生于任何年龄，以20—40岁为多，男性略多于女性。任何季节均可发病，而以春、秋两季发病较高。中医称之为“口眼喎斜”，亦称“吊线风”、“口僻”。

papers.title: Pneumokokové nákazy a možnosti prevence
papers.abstract: Pneumokokova onemocněni patři mezi nejcastějsi respiracni bakterialni onemocněni postihujici různe věkove kategorie. U děti do dvou let věku a naopak u osob nad 65 let věku bývaji klinicke průběhy nejzavažnějsi. V dětskem věku způsobuje Streptococcus pneumoniae pestrou skalu různých onemocněni od nejzavažnějsich invazivnich, jako jsou meningitidy a septikemie, přes pneumonie až po život zpravidla neohrožujici, avsak o to cetnějsi akutni otitidy a sinusitidy. Incidence pneumokokových onemocněni se v různých zemich lisi. Ve stavajici situaci je aplikovana v EU buď plosna strategie, nebo ockovani rizikových skupin. U plosneho přistupu se uplatňuji schemata 2 plus 1 nebo 3 plus 1.

papers.title: INTERSTITIAL LUNG DISEASE in RHEUMATIC DISEASES: AN UPDATE of the 2018 REVIEW
papers.abstract: Interstitial lung disease (ILD) is a potential severe complication of various rheumatic diseases, typically connective tissue diseases (CTD), associated with significant morbidity and mortality. ILD may occur during the course of the disease but may also be its first manifestation. Several cell types are involved in ILD's pathogenesis, and if not controlled, pulmonary inflammation may lead to pulmonary fibrosis.

papers.title: 골막성 골육종의 무병 생존 13년 후 다른 부위에 발생한 전형적 골육종
papers.abstract: 골막성 골육종은 골육종의 약 1-2%를 차지히는 드문 질환으로써, 국소 재발이나 전이는 3년 이내에 대부분 발생하고, 전이는 대부분 폐에서 일어나며 골전이는 드물다고 알려져 있다. 저자들은 근위 경골 골막성 골종양 성공적인 치료 후 13년 만에 상완골 근위부에 전형적인 골육종이 발생한 증례를 경험하여 이를 문헌 고찰과 함께 보고하는는 바이다.

papers.title: Alimentäre Intoxikation (Toxikose, Koma dyspepticum)
papers.abstract: Das Stadium dyspepticum, das sich durch keinerlei besondere Züge vor anderen Formen akuter Dyspepsie auszeichnet, kann nun unter gewissen, heute glücklicherweise seltener gewordenen Umständen ziemlich plötzlich in die sogenannte alimentäre Intoxikation übergehen. Zuerst macht sich ein hochgradiger Erregungszustand geltend, der sich bis zu tonisch-klonischen Krämpfen steigern kann. Dabei steigt das Fieber häufig bis 39 bis 40° an. Die Zeit der Unruhe, des monotonen Geschreies und der Konvulsionen dauert aber meist nicht lange. Das Kind verfällt bald in den Zustand der Bewußtseinstrübung, der sich bis zum Koma steigern kann. Die Kinder lassen sich nur schwer aus dem Schlafzustand erwecken, und aufgeweckt, verfallen sie nach kurzem, jämmerlichem Geschrei viel rascher als das gesunde Kind wieder in einen schlafähnlichen Zustand. In diesem Schlaf, der immer wieder von gellendem Aufschreien unterbrochen wird, werden die Lider halb offengehalten. Bei einem zweieinhalb Monate alten Säugling unserer Beobachtung, der tagelang bewußtlos mit halb offenen Augen dagelegen hatte, entwickelte sich eine doppelseitige Xerophthalmie e lagophthalmo. Aber auch wenn man das Kind weckt, hat es einen auffallend starren Blick, nicht selten mit Schielstellung der Augen. Es fixiert nicht mehr. Die Pupillen sind ganz eng! Auf Schmerzreize antwortet das Kind nur sehr träge mit Abwehrbewegungen oder Geschrei oder es reagiert überhaupt nicht mehr. Das Kind befindet sich anscheinend in einem schweren Vergiftungszustand.

papers.title: Temperature in Yellow Fever
papers.abstract: peculiar odor, not experienced in cither the discrete or confluent varieties.The diagnosis was, in some cases, difficult, from the resemblance to other exanthemeta, and because the characteristic appearances would not become evident till the patient was mori- bund or even dead; and sometimes they were discovered, even then, only by diligent search over the entire body.

papers.title: Quilotórax traumático como única complicación de herida por arma de fuego en el tórax.
papers.abstract: El quilotórax consiste en la acumulación del líquido linfático del conducto torácico o de sus vasos afluentes en la cavidad pleural; no es una condición común (1). Existen varias causas de quilotórax, siendo una de ellas la traumática, la cual puede resultar de un traumatismo directo al conducto torácico o como complicación de cirugía o procedimientos intratorácicos.

papers.title: Étude du déterminisme des pneumopathies interstitielles diffuses associées à la polyarthrite rhumatoïde : facteurs de susceptibilité génétiques et environnementaux
papers.abstract: La pneumopathie interstitielle diffuse (PID) est une manifestation extra-articulaire severe de la polyarthrite rhumatoide (PR) associee a une surmortalite importante. Pres de 10% des patients atteints de PR vont developper une forme clinique avec presence de symptomes respiratoires mais la realisation d’un scanner thoracique de haute definition peut mettre en evidence des anomalies interstitielles chez 30 a 58% des patients. Plusieurs facteurs de risque ont ete associes a la PR-PID tels que le sexe masculin, l’âge, le tabagisme ou l’activite de la PR. L’impact des traitements specifiques de la PR comme le methotrexate (MTX) ou les anti-TNF sur la survenue d’une PID reste actuellement debattu.La PR-PID partage avec la fibrose pulmonaire idiopathique (FPI) plusieurs caracteristiques communes telles que l’aspect de pneumopathie interstitielle commune (PIC), certains facteurs de risque (le sexe masculin, l’âge, le tabagisme…) ainsi qu’une forte morbi-mortalite. Ces points communs laissent suspecter des mecanismes physiopathogeniques ainsi que des facteurs de risques genetiques communs entre PR-PID et FPI.L’objectif de cette these etait 1) d’identifier des facteurs de risque genetiques associes a la PR-PID par une approche gene-candidat, 2) d’etudier l’impact d’une exposition par MTX sur la survenue d’une PID au cours de la PR.Par l’analyse de donnees du sequencage d’exome de 101 patients atteints de PR-PID et de 1010 temoins, nous avons mis en evidence dans la population PR-PID un exces de mutations au sein de genes precedemment lies a des formes familiales de fibrose pulmonaires : TERT, RTEL1, PARN et SFTPC (OR = 3,17 ; IC95% : 1,53 – 6,12 ; P = 9,45x10-4). Dans une deuxieme etude genetique d’association cas-temoins internationale incluant 620 patients PR-PID, 614 patients PR sans PID et 5448 temoins, nous avons identifie une forte association entre le facteur de risque genetique principal de la FPI, MUC5B rs35705950, et la PR-PID (ORaj = 3,1 ; IC95% : 1,8 – 5,4 ; P = 7,4x10-5). Cette association etait restreinte au sous-phenotype de PIC.Dans une troisieme etude retrospective d’association cas-temoins internationale incluant 410 patients PR-PID et 673 patients PR sans PID, nous avons identifie une association inverse entre exposition au MTX et survenue d’une PID au cours de la PR (OR = 0,43 ; IC95% : 0,26 – 0,69 ; P = 0,0006). Cette association etait observee quel que soit le type de PID (PIC ou autre). Enfin, au sein des patients PR-PID, l’exposition au MTX etait associe a un delai de detection de la PID (difference de 3,6 ans apres ajustement, P < 0,001).Nos deux premiers travaux ont confirme l’existence d’une architecture genetique commune a la FPI et la PR-PID, notamment chez les patients presentant une PIC. Ces resultats soutiennent l’evaluation dans la PR-PID des traitements specifiques a la FPI. Dans notre troisieme etude, le MTX n’etait pas un facteur de risque de survenue d’une PID au cours de la PR.En conclusion, La PR-PID est une maladie complexe multifactorielle constituee de multiples facteurs de risques genetiques et environnementaux. Une meilleure comprehension des mecanismes impliques dans le developpement d’une PR-PID permettra une meilleure identification des patients a risque ainsi que l’etablissement de strategies therapeutiques adaptees.

papers.title: 诊断学讲座(10) 烧心
papers.abstract: 烧心是指在剑突或胸骨下一种烧灼或发热的感觉,有时可呈烧灼样疼痛,饮水或服碱性药物后症状可缓解,这是食管炎的特异症状。1 病因及发病机制 烧心通常被认为胃酸分泌过多,或含有胃酸的胃内容物返流到食管引起。但在无胃酸的病人也可出现烧心,因此烧心的发病机制不仅是胃酸引起,可能与下列因素有关:1.1 食管运动功能异常 用气囊扩张食管下1/3

papers.title: 护理干预对儿童高热惊厥治疗效果的影响
papers.abstract: 高热惊厥(FC)是儿童时期最常见的疾病之一,反复多次的热性惊厥可以造成发育中脑的损伤,少部分会发生智力低下及继发癫痫的危险[1].本研究通过对230例FC患儿采取相应的护理干预,取得较好的效果。

papers.title: Mechanic’s Hands in a Patient With Antisynthetase Syndrome
papers.abstract: Polymyositis or dermatomyositis may be complicated with antisynthetase syndrome, which can include inflammatory muscle disease, interstitial lung disease, Raynaud phenomenon, arthritis, and other symptoms.

papers.title: First manifestation of a polyglandular autoimmune syndrome as acute adrenal insufficiency in the 2nd trimester of pregnancy
papers.abstract: Introduction Unspecific pregnancy-associated symptoms like nausea and emesis can potentially mask life-threatening underlying causes. In this report, we describe a case of acute adrenal insufficiency in a patient presenting with severe hyperemesis, hypotension and hyponatremia at 19 weeks of gestation.

papers.title: Chronic cough due to occupational factors
papers.abstract: Abstract Within the large variety of subtypes of chronic cough, either defined by their clinical or pathogenetic causes, occupational chronic cough may be regarded as one of the most preventable forms of the disease. Next to obstructive airway diseases such as asthma or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, which are sometimes concomitant with chronic cough, this chronic airway disease gains importance in the field of occupational medicine since classic fiber-related occupational airway diseases will decrease in the future. Apart from acute accidents and incidental exposures which may lead to an acute form of cough, there are numerous sources for the development of chronic cough within the workplace. Over the last years, a large number of studies has focused on occupational causes of respiratory diseases and it has emerged that chronic cough is one of the most prevalent work-related airway diseases. Best-known examples of occupations related to the development of cough are coal miners, hard-rock miners, tunnel workers, or concrete manufacturing workers. As chronic cough is often based on a variety of non-occupational factors such as tobacco smoke, a distinct separation into either occupational or personally -evoked can be difficult. However, revealing the occupational contribution to chronic cough and to the symptom cough in general, which is the commonest cause for the consultation of a physician, can significantly lead to a reduction of the socioeconomic burden of the disease.
papers.venue: Journal of Occupational Medicine and Toxicology

papers.title: Postmenopausal vulval disease
papers.abstract: Vulval disease in the postmenopausal age group is relatively common. Some vulval conditions such as lichen sclerosus are more prevalent in the postmenopausal years. Often more than one condition is present at the same time. Accurate diagnosis is essential for effective treatment. The risk of progression to malignancy associated with some of these diseases dictates long-term surveillance.

papers.title: Tractament Farmacològic de l'Enuresi
papers.abstract: espanolLa enuresis no es una enfermedad sino un sintoma. Como tal puede ser producido por diferentes patologia. El 2% de las enuresis puras tienen una patologia organica de base. Entre las enuresis funcionales hemos diferenciado dos grupos: las enuresis nocturnas puras y las que ademas de escapes nocturnos tienen sintomas o escapes diurnos. En este segundo grupo los estudios urdinamicos demuestran con alta frecuencia «inestabilidad vesical». Estos ninos responden muy bien al tratamiento con oxibutinina. catalaL'enuresi no es una malaltia, sine) un simptoma. Com a tal, pot ser produit per diferents patologies. El 2% de les enuresis pures tenen una patologia organica de base. Entre les enuresis funcionals hem diferenciat dos grups: les enuresis nocturnes pures i les que, arnes d'escapaments nocturns, tenen simptomes o escapaments diurns. En aquest segon grup, els estudis urodinamics demostren, amb alta frequencia, «inestabilitat vesical». Aquests infants responen molt be al tractament amb oxibutinina. EnglishEnuresis is not a disease but a symptom, and as such, it can be produced by various pathological conditions. 2% of pure enuresses have some organic pathology as their basis. Among cases of functional enuresis we have differentiated two groups: nocturnal enuresis pure and simple and those cases which present symptoms or lealcages in the daytime as well as bedwerring at night. In this second group urodynamic studies very frequently show «bladder instability». These children respond very well to treatment with oxybutinine.
papers.venue: Pediatria catalana: butlletí de la Societat Catalana de Pediatria

papers.title: Recurrent abdominal pain in children: a clinical approach
papers.abstract: The term 'recurrent abdominal pain', or RAP, refers mainly to the duration of painful period and frequency of pain.The commonly accepted duration is at least three months in the preceding period, and over this three-month period, there are at least three episodes of pain that are severe enough to affect the daily activities of the affected patients.Over the years, with advances in medical technology and better understanding of the pathophysiology of abdominal pain, more and more organic causes have been identified.However, the most common cause of RAP in children is still functional in origin.

papers.title: Treatment Delay
papers.abstract: Abstract Delay in the reporting of symptoms or in the start of treatment for a life‐threatening illness may, paradoxically, be associated with increased survival. This is due to the confounding effect of severity of illness, the more rapidly developing forms of disease being associated both with shorter pretreatment intervals and with decreased survival. The point is illustrated by published data on breast cancer and tetanus.

papers.title: Description clinique et traitement de l’algie vasculaire de la face
papers.abstract: L’algie vasculaire de la face est une cephalee primaire a predominance masculine se presentant sous deux formes : episodique et chronique qui evolue par periodes de 45 jours a 2 mois avec 1 a 3 crises par jour de 45 minutes a 2 heures. Elle se manifeste par une violente douleur unilaterale plutot retro-oculaire accompagnee de signes sympathiques a type de larmoiement et de rhinorrhee. Le diagnostic est fait par l’interrogatoire et ne necessite donc pas d’examens complementaires. Pour la crise, le traitement fait appel au sumatriptan injectable ou a l’oxygenotherapie et pour le fond au verapamil, aux sels de lithium ou au topiramate. Dans certains cas ou le nombre de crises est superieur a 2, on pourra recourir a des injections de corticoides, a l’emergence du nerf d’Arnold, voire en cas de crises resistant a tous les traitements, a la chirurgie de stimulation de l’hypothalamus.

papers.title: Is snoring a disease?
papers.abstract: Snoring is an abnormal sonorous breathing sound which occurs during sleep caused by obstructive conditions of various degrees of severity in the upper airway.The problems of snoring can be divided into two categories. One is the stenosis which causes snoring, and the other is the sound of snoring itself.Excessive airway stenosis causes frequent apnea, which leads to various complications. Sleep apnea syndrome is recognized as a life-threatening condition that requires immediate treatment.What is not recognized by physicians is the problem caused by the sound of snoring. The sonorous sound annoys the bed-partner or co-sleepers, and their complaints often make the snorer reluctant to sleep with other people. In an extreme case, the sound may prevent a patient from being admitted to a hospital. Therefore, snoring which does not accompany apnea should also be treated as a serious disease.

papers.title: [Respiratory side-effects of drugs].
papers.abstract: Three patients, men aged 65 and 49 and a woman of 38 years, presented with drug-induced interstitial pneumonitis due to nilutamide, bleomycin and nitrofurantoin usage respectively. The signs and symptoms of drug-induced interstitial pneumonitis occur from within several hours up to months or years after the start of treatment, and sometimes even after the cessation of treatment, and consist of a dry cough, dyspnoea, fever and crackles upon auscultation. The results of further investigations are atypical and consist of abnormalities on the X-ray or CT of the thorax and lymphocytosis in the bronchoalveolar lavage fluid. The mechanisms of damage usually include direct pulmonary toxicity and indirect inflammatory or immunological processes. In most patients, the pulmonary abnormalities disappear after cessation of the drug treatment. Sometimes the disease progresses to pulmonary fibrosis and respiratory failure despite treatment with corticosteroids.

papers.title: Phantom Sweating
papers.abstract: Phantom sweating is a sensation in which the patient feels that sweat is about to burst out of skin pores, but in which sweating never actually occurs.
